comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content: Jean Harold Edward St. Cyr was involved in a scandal alleging he was merely posing as a member of a wealthy French family, but was, in fact from Texas.

comment.author: 24231207@N07
comment._content:
With the following citation, I would imagine this photo is from 1914.

Special to The New York Times. 
April 28, 1915,
Section , Page 13, 

PHILADELPHIA, April 27. -- Jean H. E. Saint Cyr, whose pink silk sweater and sky-blue shirts attracted much attention in Bar Harbor last Summer,

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: So, was he found to be really a St. Cyr, or was he truly insincere?

comment.author: 10799299@N00
comment._content: According to this newspaper article news.google.com/newspapers?id=OQAdAAAAIBAJ&sjid=IpsEA... St Cyr died in 1967 in La Jolla California, still claiming to be a French aristocrat. However, he left money in his will to Hugh Thompson of Waco, Texas who in 1916 told the New York Times St. Cyr was not his brother Jack. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10C1EF6355C1373...
